node.title: 'Bad day at the office': Perrottet acknowledges disappointing by-election results
node.description: In the wash-up from yesterday's historic ALP by-election win in the seat of Bega, Premier Dominic Perrottet concedes he needs to reflect on the results in the four seats.
node.content:
["Premier Dominic Perrottet says he takes full responsibility for the loss of the seat of Bega and the swing against the government\u00a0in yesterday's state by-elections.", "The south coast seat is set to be taken by the ALP's candidate\u00a0Dr Michael Holland in\u00a0an historic victory for the opposition.", "Bega had been held on a 6.9\u00a0per cent margin\u00a0by\u00a0outgoing MP Andrew Constance for 17 years, but with 30\u00a0per cent of the vote counted, the swing to the ALP is\u00a0more than 13 per cent.", "Mr Perrottet said it had been \"a bad day at the office\", which\u00a0caused him to reflect on the messages coming from the local communities in the four electorates.", "\"It's certainly disappointing to lose the seat of Bega, that's the\u00a0way it looks like it's heading \u2014 it's a tough day,\" he said.", "The Premier said his visit to bushfire-ravaged Cobargo, located in the seat, showed him that residents were still suffering and the government could do better to help them.", "\"We've got a strong track record there, it's a community in Bega that's gone through a very difficult\u00a0time off the back of the bushfires, and I'll look into that, \" he said.", "The Premier pointed to the result in Strathfield, the seat vacated by former opposition leader Jodi McKay,\u00a0as a sign of \"green shoots\".", "Strathfield was\u00a0retained by Labor's\u00a0Jason Yat-Sen Li\u00a0but the government saw a 6 per cent swing towards it under\u00a0Bridget Sakr.", "\"To have a swing towards us in government is pleasing, but\u2026\u00a0ultimately I take responsibility for the results.\"", "Liberal candidate Tim James claimed victory in Willoughby\u00a0while the Nationals won\u00a0Monaro, although there were swings against the government in both.", "Mr Perrottet denied that the government's approach to the pandemic had contributed to the result.", "", "
Dr Michael Holland [left], with Opposition Leader Chris Minns,\u00a0said the result gave\u00a0him a mandate to address local issues.(ABC News: Kelly Fuller)
", "Opposition Leader\u00a0Chris Minns\u00a0said\u00a0the results in the four by-elections showed\u00a0a high\u00a0level of dissatisfaction\u00a0with the coalition's direction.", "\"It's no good for hundreds of thousands of people to register an unhappiness with the direction of the government and then for the senior levels including the Premier to simply say nothing's changed, we don't hear the message at all,\" he said.", "\"We want the NSW Government to do better, that\u00a0might sound strange coming from an opposition but we are in the middle of a pandemic and our focus is on the people of NSW.\"", "", "
Outgoing Bega MP Andrew Constance says health has been the major voting factor.
", "The former state member for Bega,\u00a0Andrew Constance, acknowledged the local community's concerns about health.", "He believes the by-election results were largely based on local issues.\u00a0", "\"The [Bega] community has made a decision in relation to health, particularly,\" he said.", "\"He's [Michael Holland] made some very big commitments in relation to health, and we'll just see where that goes.\"", "Liberal candidate Fiona Kotvojs has said\u00a0she will not concede defeat in the Bega by-election\u00a0despite the\u00a0double-digit swing against her and Premier Perrottet congratulating her Labor opponent."]
